results.title: Bill Brandt
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Master Photographers Series”.
In this rare insight, Brandt shows some of his favourite photographs among them pictures of Paris in the 1920s, his compassionate scenes of Britain in the Depression, his Nudes and many distinguished portraits.

results.title: Antarctic Vigil
results.creator_credit: Dept of Interior for the Australian Film Board in association with The Australian National Anatarctic Research Expedition and Film Australia
results.brief_description: An account of research undertaken by Australian scientists at the Antarctic outposts of Macquarie, Kerguelen and Heard Islands. Shows life on these islands including work at the meteorological stations and studies of the unusual animal, bird and plant life found in Arctic regions.

results.title: Master Photographers Series
results.brief_description: A six part series on the men who started their careers early this century, and who are considered pioneers in their specific fields of photography.

results.title: Andreas Feininger
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Master Photographers Series”.
A fascinating look at the technical possibilities of creative photography and at Feininger’s firm belief that the camera can enrich people’s way of seeing.

results.title: Antz [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Eric Darnell, Tim Johnson, Aron Warner, Brad Lewis, Patty Wooton, NBCUniversal and PDI Group
results.brief_description: This dazzling computer animated comedy uses with great comic effect the neurotic persona of Woody Allen in order to tell the story of Z (Allen), a down trodden worker ant struggling to assert his individuality amongst the conformity of the ant colony. Z’s transformation from faceless nobody to unwilling hero eventuates when he volunteers to swap places with his fearless soldier ant buddy Weaver (Sylvester Stallone), in order to get close to the feisty Princess Bala (Sharon Stone). This lands the nervous insect right in the middle of the brutal termite wars and a series of misadventures, accumulating in the search for the mythical “Insectopia”. Directors Eric Darnell and Tim Johnson have a lot of fun by visually suggesting a microscopic world not unlike New York city and by giving the animated ants the physical traits and mannerisms of their voice-over counterparts. Gene Hackman, Dan Aykroyd, Jennifer Lopez, Danny Glover, Christopher Walken and Ann Bancroft are among the many who contribute their voices.

results.title: Antonio
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of an Italian immigrant, a widower, living alone with his memories, his Bible, and Dante which he learned to read in English. He talks about his past, his children, of good times and bad. A warm portrait of an aging man who chooses freedom and independence even though it at times means solitude.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ianzelo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Another Tuesday night
results.creator_credit: Lynn Hegarty, Mark Gould and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Married women who are in paid jobs spend an average 36 hours a week on unpaid household work, whereas married men do an average of 18.1/2 hours a week of unpaid work. This dramatised story explores one family’s conflict of sharing the load between both partners working fulltime and the responsibility of running a home and caring for their young daughter. On this particular Tuesday evening, Bridget (Karen Vickery), tired and rather tense, finally turns on her partner Mark (Richard Healy) over the matter of washing the dishes. She feels he is not sharing the full burden of domestic duties preferring to participate in the easier and more pleasant tasks and leaving her to the real housework such as cleaning the toilet, preparing dinner and doing the dishes. What is fair to both in balancing and sharing paid work, housework and childcare? Booklet included with video.
